• Want to stay up to date with every track your BFF bandmate drops, or have you found an artist you love on BandLab? With our new Subscribe to Posts feature you’ll never miss out on posts from your favourite music makers!
• For Blues, Rock, Metal and Jazz fans – we’ve added a new set of curated tracks to inspire you. You can Fork them from the ‘Let’s Make Music’ screen!
• iPad users rejoice! As well as the usual housekeeping and UI improvements across the board, we’ve made a bunch of UI improvements for iPad.

TL;DR: Your Feed experience is about to change!

• You can now share text posts! Whether it’s an interesting link or an important update for your fans, it’s now easier than ever to share information with your followers. You can also post directly to your communities from the Feed.
• Sometimes you’ll want to share a private project outside of BandLab. You can now generate secret links and download revisions to share them with others.
• UI improvements on various screens for better iPad support.

• Improved Instruments Library: We add new instruments and packs every month and our instruments library is getting bigger and bigger! To make it easier to get to your favorite instruments, we've split the all available instruments into a brand new Library and Discover experience.
• We've added playback controls to our forkable tracks lists on Let's Make Music Screen to make it easier to select a track you would like to work with. Oh, and one more updated related to recommended tracks - tracks now load lightning fast!
• Further UI improvements for iPad layout.
• And of course stability improvements and bug-fixes.

BandLab now supports Siri Shortcuts!

With Siri Shortcuts you can quickstart new song ideas, quickly jump into your most recent project or get your favourite tracks playing just by saying the magic words! You can also customize your own shortcuts by recording custom phrases like "Hey Siri, I have a song idea" to immediately start a new BandLab project.

Check out the built-in supported shortcuts on our brand new Siri Shortcuts page via the Let's Make Music page. Siri Shortcuts are available only on iOS 12 so please make sure you're running the latest version of iOS.

TL;DR: Mixer in Video Mix and MIDI Editor improvements.

What’s New
We’ve added Mixer into Video Mix to make it possible to adjust the volume for the backing track or recorded video so that you can get the best sound possible.

In addition, it’s now easier to open your own revisions in the Video Mix - hit the red “Open” button and you will see the option to open revision in Video Mix or Mix Editor.

Improvements and Bug Fixes
We’ve updated MIDI Editor with small (but important) UI tweaks to make it easier to see octaves and navigate. In addition, we’ve added region indicator to the timeline so that you know which regions you’re working with.
Set of Video Mix stability and UI improvements.
Fixed: Annoying bug that caused issues with the playback after launching the app.
Fixed: Crash that occurred when editing certain revision settings.
Fixed: Bug that caused issues with mastering when editing preset that been earlier edited in the Web app.

Have feedback or an issue to report? Let us know at support@bandlab.com.

Improvements and Bug Fixes
Video Mix bug fixes and stability improvements, including a fix for a rare bug causing a permanent loader after stopping the recording.
Various bug fixes in the Global Player, including a bug fix - when the player doesn’t appear on the screen after starting playback.
Various improvements in the Mix Editor and Tuner, including better mute and solo logic and UI improvements in Tuner.
Fixed: Bug - Follow notifications were repeatedly displayed in the list while scrolling.

Have feedback or an issue to report? Let us know at support@bandlab.com.

Improvements and Bug Fixes:


Bluetooth is back.
 Playback issue is fixed. 
General stability improvements and bug fixes.  

See something wrong? Send your feedback to support@bandlab.com.

We’ve added Mixer into Video Mix to make it possible to adjust the volume for the backing track or recorded video so that you can get the best sound possible.

In addition, it’s now easier to open your own revisions in the Video Mix - hit the red “Open” button and you will see the option to open revision in Video Mix or Mix Editor.

Improvements and Bug Fixes
We’ve updated MIDI Editor with small (but important) UI tweaks to make it easier to see octaves and navigate. In addition, we’ve added region indicator to the timeline so that you know which regions you’re working with.
Set of Video Mix stability and UI improvements.
Fixed: Annoying bug that caused issues with the playback after launching the app.
Fixed: Crash that occurred when editing certain revision settings.
Fixed: Bug that caused issues with mastering when editing preset that been earlier edited in the Web app.

Have feedback or an issue to report? Let us know at support@bandlab.com.

Improvements and Bug Fixes
Video Mix bug fixes and stability improvements, including a fix for a rare bug causing a permanent loader after stopping the recording.
Various bug fixes in the Global Player, including a bug fix - when the player doesn’t appear on the screen after starting playback.
Various improvements in the Mix Editor and Tuner, including better mute and solo logic and UI improvements in Tuner.
Fixed: Bug - Follow notifications were repeatedly displayed in the list while scrolling.

Have feedback or an issue to report? Let us know at support@bandlab.com.

Improvements and Bug Fixes:


Bluetooth is back.
 Playback issue is fixed. 
General stability improvements and bug fixes.

TL;DR: MIDI Editing! And a new mini player with neat swipe gestures.

What's New

- Since we launched MIDI instruments many of you requested MIDI editing and we’re pleased and excited to bring MIDI editing to our iOS app! You can now edit MIDI recordings – transpose, add or remove notes, and experiment with the arrangement just by using simple gestures. To access MIDI editor record a region and tap on pencil button in the bottom right corner on the instrument view ;)
- We recently updated our Global Player and now it’s Mini Player’s turn: we’ve updated the look, improved stability UX and added neat swipe actions so you can change track by swiping player left or right.
- When looping regions you'll now see a handy menu where you can select the loop length, including an option to loop region till the end of the mix. Neat!

Improvements and bug fixes:
- Creator Connect videos now autoplay when you swipe through profiles
- Global Player UI and stability improvements
- Various bug fixes related to landscape mode and changing screen orientation
- Fixed issue that very rarely crashed the app when mastering a new track

If you have any feedback or run into issues feel free to email us at support@bandlab.com.

Ever launched BandLab and had to wait a few seconds before it opened? Too long, we know. Our crew gave the app a significant tune-up so you can get started in no time!
Fixed an issue where the wrong revision would be highlighted inside a project’s Tree View. That’s not gonna happen anymore.

Have feedback or an issue to report? Let us know at support@bandlab.com.

TL;DR: Create music videos with BandLab!

What’s New

We’re thrilled to release Video Mix, our brand new feature that makes it easy to create awesome sounding video clips to showcase your talent right from your mobile device.

Whether you’re rapping freestyle over a beat or laying down a hot new solo, our world-class FX and real-time monitoring will ensure you sound your best. (For best results, use headphones when recording!)

Video Mix can be opened directly from the Let’s Make Music screen or via any forkable track - just hit the Fork button and select “Open in Video Mix”. With millions of tracks in BandLab, and professionally curated beats and backing tracks updated daily, you’ll never be short of inspiration to get creating.

Check out our blog for more information and happy clip making - if you share your video on BandLab or on other social media platforms, don’t forget to tag or mention us to stand a chance to be featured! ;)

TL;DR: Creator Connect puts your favourite musicians front and centre.

What’s New

We’ve taken Creator Connect to the next level by showcasing your artist influences directly on your profile. Fellow creators can now see who inspires you, making it easier to find others with shared musical tastes and build more amazing collabs!

Hit up your Creator Connect settings page to add your favourite artists (up to 10). Be sure to visit our blog for more details ;)

Improvements and Bug Fixes:

- Improved project Tree View page to include better support for offline mode
- Improved MIDI Editor to include focusing area with notes when editing existing regions
- Fixed: Rare crash that occurred when selecting a backing track on Video Mix’s Pick a Track page
- Fixed: Jumpy behaviour when opening post page from Feed
- Fixed: A nasty crash that occasionally occurred during mastering tracks

Have feedback or an issue to report? Let us know at support@bandlab.com.

Hit up your Creator Connect settings page to add your favourite artists (up to 10). Be sure to visit our blog for more details ;)

Improvements and Bug Fixes:

- Improved project Tree View page to include better support for offline mode
- Improved MIDI Editor to include focusing area with notes when editing existing regions
- Fixed: Rare crash that occurred when selecting a backing track on Video Mix’s Pick a Track page
- Fixed: Jumpy behaviour when opening post page from Feed
- Fixed: A nasty crash that occasionally occurred during mastering tracks

Have feedback or an issue to report? Let us know at support@bandlab.com.

TL;DR: Creator Connect puts your favourite musicians front and centre.

TL;DR: MIDI Editor gets a bunch of new features. Plus, improvements to Video Mix.

What’s New

We added new features to the MIDI Editor that will vastly improve your music making experience. For one, you can now edit multiple notes. Just tap on an empty area, drag to select your notes and move or remove them all at once. You can even open the MIDI Editor without having to record a region first.

This update also includes various Video Mix improvements, including the automatic disabling of monitoring when you publish a recorded video.

Improvements and Bug Fixes

Fixed: Bug with cut-off bottom panel after forking track from Need Inspiration list
Fixed: Rare crash that occurred when opening Video Mix
Fixed: Issue with mixdown processing when applying mastering track right after creating revision

Have feedback or an issue to report? Let us know at support@bandlab.com.

TL;DR: Mixer in Video Mix and MIDI Editor improvements.

What’s New
We’ve added Mixer into Video Mix to make it possible to adjust the volume for the backing track or recorded video so that you can get the best sound possible.

In addition, it’s now easier to open your own revisions in the Video Mix - hit the red “Open” button and you will see the option to open revision in Video Mix or Mix Editor.

Improvements and Bug Fixes
We’ve updated MIDI Editor with small (but important) UI tweaks to make it easier to see octaves and navigate. In addition, we’ve added region indicator to the timeline so that you know which regions you’re working with.
Set of Video Mix stability and UI improvements.
Fixed: Annoying bug that caused issues with the playback after launching the app.
Fixed: Crash that occurred when editing certain revision settings.
Fixed: Bug that caused issues with mastering when editing preset that been earlier edited in the Web app.

Have feedback or an issue to report? Let us know at support@bandlab.com.

Introducing BandLab 9.0! With this major update, we present exciting Mix Editor features and...a BRAND NEW CHAT!

Custom FX Presets
Ever wanted to customize a preset or create one that’s uniquely yours? Guess what, now you can!

To adjust any of the effects inside a preset, just hit the FX button on any track, scroll to the preset of your choice and tap the Edit icon.

If you prefer to start from scratch, simply scroll to “None” instead and work from there. Choose up to 8 of our 40+ effects, including reverbs, equalizers, compressors and more.

Cycle
When you work on a million-dollar beat that contains layers of audio and MIDI, you’ll want to stay focused and minimize any distractions. That's where Cycle comes in handy. Make use of the cycle area to repeatedly play a particular segment of your project.

To learn more, read the Cycle article in our help center.

Instruments Browser
We've updated the Instruments Browser, making it easier to find the exact sounds you want. We believe that the all-new smart filters and curated collections will spark plenty of inspiration for your next big hit.

Note: These features will be rolled out gradually over the next few weeks. Keep a lookout for them!
